metadata.titel_preek: Advent Begins in the Dark: Salisbury

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from the 'Abomination' of the heart of darkness and God's silence toward the 'burst' of God's final breaking in to destroy evil.

subject.identificatie: God (The Master of the House / The Wounded Surgeon)
tekstueel_bewijs: God will come, and his justice will prevail
he will destroy evil and pain
The day will dawn on us from on high

object.identificatie: Deliverance/Light for those in the shadow of death
tekstueel_bewijs: to give light to those that sit in darkness
destroy evil and pain in all its forms
the promise that, against all the evidence, there is a God who cares

ontvanger.identificatie: The least, the last, and the lost (The Hearer)
tekstueel_bewijs: those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver/Watcher, not the Subject.

tekstueel_bewijs: Advent teaches us to delay Christmas
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; the Church is the Helper that keeps the Subject's return in view.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicitly the power that enables 'watching' in the void.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and the Silence of God
tekstueel_bewijs: delivered us into the hand of our iniquities
the world ruled by sin and death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not a moral lapse but the 'Abomination' and 'Wrath of God'—a void human effort cannot fill.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the believer to 'watch' and serve while waiting.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (e.g., the woman from Pan Am 103)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Service to others/Casting away works of darkness
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical 'doing' is a result of being 'astounded' by the rumor of God's coming.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: we have been a long time

voorbeelden: commands the doorkeeper to be on the watch
the more you will want to immerse yourself
Advent teaches us to delay Christmas
take a fearless inventory of the darkness
The news... is nothing less than astounding
transcendent power breaking in upon us

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the total inability of the human subject to save themselves (lack of Pouvoir) and the 'astounding' power of God to act from the outside.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at S2 (Darkness), rejects ~S1 (Sentimentalism), moves through the tension of S2 to the 'burst' of S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is not resolved by human effort but by the 'Second Coming'—a vertical intervention.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; sin is described as a 'polluted garment' and 'Abomination'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is radically theocentric. It posits a human subject that is 'unclean' and 'starved,' while God is the sole agent of the 'burst' of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: willing to take a fearless inventory of the darkness

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God will come, and his justice will prevail
man so perverted that he was disowned by his own mother

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Isaiah, the Doorkeeper) are used as voices of lament or warning, not as moral templates to copy.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Isaiah is a fellow-sufferer waiting for God's action.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief through the acknowledgment of reality; hope based on external rescue.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative of the 'Time Between' perfectly integrates the human experience of suffering with the theological promise of return.
spanning_punten: The silence of God vs. the promise of His care.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: he will destroy evil and pain in all its forms

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not explicitly named, but the 'astounding voice' functions as the source of Pouvoir.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total depravity ('even our righteous deeds are like filthy rags').

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains a strict hierarchy where God is the Subject of the primary narrative program (Salvation) and man is the Subject of the secondary program (Watching/Waiting).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is the 'Grammar of Grace'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin/Death/Silence) is already maximally intensified.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's coming) precedes and enables Ethics (the woman serving others).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that refuses to turn the Gospel into a 'to-do' list.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the Auden/Eliot quotes; Greimas reveals that these quotes serve to intensify the 'Opponent' actant.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would explain Isaiah's context; Greimas shows how the preacher uses Isaiah to position the hearer as a 'Receiver' of a future action.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that the 'scented candles' are a false 'Helper' actant that the sermon systematically deconstructs.

volledige_subject_lijst: We (have been in sin, become unclean, confess, watch)
The woman (fears, gives herself in service)
appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Exemplarist' trap by framing the woman's service as a response to fear/awe of God, not as a means to earn His favor.
